title: Google\Cloud\Vision\V1\Block
name: Block
description:
Logical element on the page.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.vision.v1.Block

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.bounding_box
params.description: The bounding box for the block. The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is read in the 'natural' orientation. For example: when the text is horizontal it might look like: 0----1 | | 3----2 when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes: 2----3 | | 1----0 and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

params.name: data.paragraphs
params.description: List of paragraphs in this block (if this blocks is of type text).

params.name: data.block_type
params.description: Detected block type (text, image etc) for this block.

params.name: data.confidence
params.description: Confidence of the OCR results on the block. Range [0, 1].

methods.name: getBoundingBox
methods.description:
The bounding box for the block.

The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is read in the 'natural' orientation. For example:

  • when the text is horizontal it might look like: 0----1 | | 3----2
  • when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes: 2----3 | | 1----0 and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.vision.v1.BoundingPoly bounding_box = 2;

The vertices are in the order of top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left. When a rotation of the bounding box is detected the rotation is represented as around the top-left corner as defined when the text is read in the 'natural' orientation. For example:

  • when the text is horizontal it might look like: 0----1 | | 3----2
  • when it's rotated 180 degrees around the top-left corner it becomes: 2----3 | | 1----0 and the vertex order will still be (0, 1, 2, 3).

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.vision.v1.BoundingPoly bounding_box = 2;
